ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Save a Sherpa data set to a FITS or ASCII file.

DESC.PARA: The save_table command saves a dataset to a FITS or column-based ASCII file. DM ASCII syntax is used to indicate that the output should be ASCII ("ahelp dmascii"). This command has no return value.

LIST.ITEM: id - the id of the dataset to use; if not given, uses the default dataset id (id=1 by default, see "ahelp get_default_id")
filename - the output filename, including path

DESC.PARA: There are several other save commands available: save_image and save_pha are recommended for those datatypes, while save_data allows the user to specify additional output options when saving to an ASCII file (column names, comment character, and separator).
Dataset 1 is saved to a FITS file named "data.fits".
The DM ASCII syntax is used with save_table to write dataset 2 to a text file.

BUGS.PARA: See the bugs pages on the Sherpa website for an up-to-date listing of known bugs.
